metadata.title: CVE-2020-25219 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
url::recvline in url.cpp in libproxy 0.4.x through 0.4.15 allows a remoteHTTP server to trigger uncontrolled recursion via a response composed of aninfinite stream that lacks a newline character. This leads to stackexhaustion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libproxy-tools - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
libproxy0.4-cil - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
libproxy1-plugin-gsettings - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
libproxy1-plugin-kconfig - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
libproxy1-plugin-mozjs - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
libproxy1-plugin-networkmanager - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
libproxy1-plugin-webkit - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
libproxy1v5 - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
python3-libproxy - 0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libproxy package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.15-10ubuntu1.1').
